paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In ATTR-PN, symptoms can present as early as the third decade of life.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac symptoms typical of heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: ATTR-CM is generally a late-onset disease, with the first cardiac symptoms typically reported by patients over 60 years of age.

functional_data.summary: The amino acid substitution of valine to methionine at position 30 (Val30Met) in the TTR protein chain is the most common disease-causing TTR variant.

variants.segregation_data: The Val30Met mutation is known to segregate with disease in families.
variants.population_frequency: The Val30Met variant is prevalent in endemic regions.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the burden of ATTR amyloidosis on patients and caregivers.
key_quotes: Approximately 100 pathogenic TTR genotypes have been identified.
The amino acid substitution of valine to methionine at position 30 (Val30Met) in the TTR protein chain is the most common disease-causing TTR variant.

tables_processed.table_caption: Patient demographics and disease characteristics by country

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data focused solely on the TTR gene as specified.
